# Neon JavaScript SDK

> TypeScript SDK for Neon services - authentication (Neon Auth) and PostgreSQL database queries (Neon Data API). Provides a unified, type-safe API with multiple authentication adapters and automatic token management.

## Documentation Files

- [llms.txt](llms.txt) - Quick start and core usage (this file)
- [llms-theming.txt](llms-theming.txt) - CSS theming and customization
- [llms-full.txt](llms-full.txt) - Complete reference (all content)

## Package Selection (Read First)

| Use Case | Package |
|----------|---------|
| Auth + Data API (any framework) | `@neondatabase/neon-js` |
| Auth only (no database queries) | `@neondatabase/auth` |
| Data API only (external auth system) | `@neondatabase/postgrest-js` |

**Choose your package:**
- **Auth + Data API** → `@neondatabase/neon-js` (includes everything)
- **Auth only** → `@neondatabase/auth` (smaller bundle, no database dependencies)
- **Data API only** → `@neondatabase/postgrest-js` (bring your own auth)

Do NOT install `@neondatabase/neon-js` if you only need authentication - use `@neondatabase/auth` instead.

## Quick Start: Next.js (Most Common)

```typescript
// 1. Install: npm install @neondatabase/neon-js

// 2. Create API route handler: app/api/auth/[...path]/route.ts
import { authApiHandler } from "@neondatabase/neon-js/auth/next";
export const { GET, POST } = authApiHandler();

// 3. Create auth client: lib/auth/client.ts
"use client";
import { createAuthClient } from "@neondatabase/neon-js/auth/next";
export const authClient = createAuthClient();

// 4. Create database client: lib/db/client.ts
import { createClient } from "@neondatabase/neon-js";
import type { Database } from "./database.types"; // Generated types (optional)

export const dbClient = createClient<Database>({
  auth: {
    url: process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_NEON_AUTH_URL!,
  },
  dataApi: {
    url: process.env.NEON_DATA_API_URL!,
  },
});

// 5. Use in components
"use client";
import { authClient } from "@/lib/auth/client";

function SignInButton() {
  const session = authClient.useSession();

  if (session.isPending) return <div>Loading...</div>;
  if (session.data) return <p>Hello, {session.data.user.name}</p>;

  return (
    <button onClick={() => authClient.signIn.email({
      email: "user@example.com",
      password: "password123"
    })}>
      Sign In
    </button>
  );
}

// 6. Query database (tokens injected automatically)
const { data: items } = await dbClient.from("items").select("*");
await dbClient.from("items").insert({ name: "New Item" });
await dbClient.from("items").update({ status: "done" }).eq("id", 1);
await dbClient.from("items").delete().eq("id", 1);
```

## Quick Start: React SPA

```typescript
// 1. Install: npm install @neondatabase/neon-js

// 2. Create client with React adapter
// Note: BetterAuthReactAdapter must be imported from subpath, not main entry
import { createClient } from "@neondatabase/neon-js";
import { BetterAuthReactAdapter } from "@neondatabase/neon-js/auth/react/adapters";

const client = createClient<Database>({
  auth: {
    adapter: BetterAuthReactAdapter(), // Must call as function
    url: import.meta.env.VITE_NEON_AUTH_URL,
  },
  dataApi: {
    url: import.meta.env.VITE_NEON_DATA_API_URL,
  },
});

// 3. Use React hooks
function App() {
  const session = client.auth.useSession();

  if (session.isPending) return <div>Loading...</div>;
  if (!session.data) return <LoginForm />;

  return <Dashboard user={session.data.user} />;
}

// 4. Auth methods
await client.auth.signIn.email({ email, password });
await client.auth.signUp.email({ email, password, name });
await client.auth.signOut();
const session = await client.auth.getSession();

// 5. Database queries
const { data } = await client.from("items").select();
```

## Quick Start: Node.js Backend

```typescript
// 1. Install: npm install @neondatabase/neon-js

// 2. Create client with vanilla adapter (default)
import { createClient } from "@neondatabase/neon-js";

const client = createClient<Database>({
  auth: {
    url: process.env.NEON_AUTH_URL!,
  },
  dataApi: {
    url: process.env.NEON_DATA_API_URL!,
  },
});

// 3. Sign in and query
await client.auth.signIn.email({ email, password });
const { data } = await client.from("users").select("id, name, email");
```

## Quick Start: Auth Only (No Database)

```typescript
// 1. Install: npm install @neondatabase/auth

// 2. Create auth client (vanilla/Node.js)
import { createAuthClient } from "@neondatabase/auth";

// First arg is URL string, second is optional config
const auth = createAuthClient(process.env.NEON_AUTH_URL!);

// 3. Use auth methods
await auth.signIn.email({ email, password });
const session = await auth.getSession();
```

## Quick Start: React SPA (Auth Only, No Database)

```typescript
// 1. Install: npm install @neondatabase/auth

// 2. Create auth client with React adapter
import { createAuthClient } from "@neondatabase/auth";
import { BetterAuthReactAdapter } from "@neondatabase/auth/react/adapters";

const auth = createAuthClient(import.meta.env.VITE_NEON_AUTH_URL, {
  adapter: BetterAuthReactAdapter(), // Must call as function
});

// 3. Use React hooks and auth methods
function App() {
  const session = auth.useSession(); // React hook

  if (session.isPending) return <div>Loading...</div>;
  if (!session.data) return <LoginForm />;

  return <Dashboard user={session.data.user} />;
}

// Auth methods
await auth.signIn.email({ email, password });
await auth.signUp.email({ email, password, name });
await auth.signOut();
```

## Quick Start: Data API Only (No Auth)

```typescript
// 1. Install: npm install @neondatabase/postgrest-js

// 2. Create client with manual token
import { NeonPostgrestClient, fetchWithToken } from "@neondatabase/postgrest-js";

const client = new NeonPostgrestClient({
  dataApiUrl: process.env.NEON_DATA_API_URL!,
  options: {
    global: {
      fetch: fetchWithToken(async () => getTokenFromYourAuthSystem()),
    },
  },
});

// 3. Query database
const { data } = await client.from("items").select("*");
```

## Auth UI Components (Next.js)

```typescript
// All UI components are included in @neondatabase/neon-js

// 1. Import CSS in layout.tsx (choose one):
// Without Tailwind:
import "@neondatabase/neon-js/ui/css";
// With Tailwind v4 (in globals.css):
// @import 'tailwindcss';
// @import '@neondatabase/neon-js/ui/tailwind';

// 2. Create provider: app/providers.tsx
"use client";
import { NeonAuthUIProvider } from "@neondatabase/neon-js/auth/react/ui";
import { authClient } from "@/lib/auth/client";
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation";
import Link from "next/link";

export function Providers({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) {
  const router = useRouter();
  return (
    <NeonAuthUIProvider
      authClient={authClient}
      navigate={router.push}
      replace={router.replace}
      onSessionChange={() => router.refresh()}
      Link={Link}
      emailOTP                            // Enable email OTP login
      social={{ providers: ["google"] }} // Enable Google OAuth
      redirectTo="/dashboard"            // Post-login redirect
      organization={{}}                  // Enable organizations
    >
      {children}
    </NeonAuthUIProvider>
  );
}

// 3. Wrap app in layout.tsx
<Providers>{children}</Providers>

// 4. Create auth page: app/auth/[path]/page.tsx
import { AuthView } from "@neondatabase/neon-js/auth/react/ui";
import { authViewPaths } from "@neondatabase/neon-js/auth/react/ui/server";

export const dynamicParams = false;
export function generateStaticParams() {
  return Object.values(authViewPaths).map((path) => ({ path }));
}

export default async function AuthPage({ params }: { params: Promise<{ path: string }> }) {
  const { path } = await params;
  return <AuthView path={path} />;
}

// Provides these routes automatically:
// /auth/sign-in, /auth/sign-up, /auth/forgot-password, /auth/reset-password,
// /auth/magic-link, /auth/two-factor, /auth/callback, /auth/sign-out

// 5. (Optional) Add middleware for protected routes: middleware.ts
import { neonAuthMiddleware } from "@neondatabase/neon-js/auth/next";

export default neonAuthMiddleware({
  loginUrl: '/auth/sign-in', // Redirect here if not authenticated
});

export const config = {
  matcher: ['/((?!_next/static|_next/image|favicon.ico|public).*)'],
};

// 6. Create account page: app/account/[path]/page.tsx
import { AccountView } from "@neondatabase/neon-js/auth/react/ui";
import { accountViewPaths } from "@neondatabase/neon-js/auth/react/ui/server";

export const dynamicParams = false;
export function generateStaticParams() {
  return Object.values(accountViewPaths).map((path) => ({ path }));
}

export default async function AccountPage({ params }: { params: Promise<{ path: string }> }) {
  const { path } = await params;
  return <AccountView path={path} />;
}

// 7. Create organization page: app/organization/[path]/page.tsx
import { OrganizationView } from "@neondatabase/neon-js/auth/react/ui";
import { organizationViewPaths } from "@neondatabase/neon-js/auth/react/ui/server";

export const dynamicParams = false;
export function generateStaticParams() {
  return Object.values(organizationViewPaths).map((path) => ({ path }));
}

export default async function OrganizationPage({ params }: { params: Promise<{ path: string }> }) {
  const { path } = await params;
  return <OrganizationView path={path} />;
}

// 8. Access session in server components
import { neonAuth } from "@neondatabase/neon-js/auth/next";

export async function Profile() {
  const { session, user } = await neonAuth();
  if (!session || !user) return <div>Not logged in</div>;
  return <div>Welcome, {user.name || user.email}</div>;
}

// 9. Use session in client components
"use client";
import { authClient } from "@/lib/auth/client";

function Dashboard() {
  const { data: session, isPending } = authClient.useSession();
  if (isPending) return <div>Loading...</div>;
  if (!session) return <div>Not authenticated</div>;
  return <h1>Welcome, {session.user.name}</h1>;
}
```

## Social Sign-In (Google, GitHub)

Google and GitHub sign-in are **enabled by default** in Neon Auth. To show social login buttons in the Auth UI, add the `social` prop to `NeonAuthUIProvider`:

```typescript
<NeonAuthUIProvider
  authClient={authClient}
  navigate={router.push}
  replace={router.replace}
  onSessionChange={() => router.refresh()}
  Link={Link}
  social={{
    providers: ["google", "github"]
  }}
>
  {children}
</NeonAuthUIProvider>
```

The sign-in and sign-up forms will automatically show Google and GitHub buttons.

### Programmatic Social Sign-In

If you need to trigger social sign-in programmatically (without the UI):

```typescript
// BetterAuth adapters (default)
await client.auth.signIn.social({
  provider: 'google', // or 'github'
  callbackURL: '/dashboard',
});

// SupabaseAuthAdapter
await client.auth.signInWithOAuth({
  provider: 'google',
  options: { redirectTo: '/dashboard' },
});
```

## Authentication Adapters

Three adapters available for different API styles. **All adapters are factory functions that must be called with `()`.**

### BetterAuthVanillaAdapter (Default)
```typescript
import { createClient } from "@neondatabase/neon-js";
// Default adapter, no need to specify
const client = createClient({ auth: { url }, dataApi: { url } });

await client.auth.signIn.email({ email, password });
await client.auth.signUp.email({ email, password, name });
const session = await client.auth.getSession();
```

### BetterAuthReactAdapter (React Hooks)
```typescript
// Note: BetterAuthReactAdapter must be imported from subpath
import { createClient } from "@neondatabase/neon-js";
import { BetterAuthReactAdapter } from "@neondatabase/neon-js/auth/react/adapters";

const client = createClient({
  auth: { adapter: BetterAuthReactAdapter(), url }, // Call as function
  dataApi: { url },
});

// React hook available
const session = client.auth.useSession();
```

### SupabaseAuthAdapter (Supabase-compatible API)
```typescript
import { createClient, SupabaseAuthAdapter } from "@neondatabase/neon-js";

const client = createClient({
  auth: { adapter: SupabaseAuthAdapter(), url }, // Call as function
  dataApi: { url },
});

// Supabase-compatible methods
await client.auth.signInWithPassword({ email, password });
await client.auth.signUp({ email, password });
const { data: { session } } = await client.auth.getSession();
client.auth.onAuthStateChange((event, session) => { /* ... */ });
```

## Database Query Patterns

All query methods follow PostgREST syntax (same as Supabase):

```typescript
// Select with filters
const { data } = await client.from("items")
  .select("id, name, status")
  .eq("status", "active")
  .order("created_at", { ascending: false })
  .limit(10);

// Select with relationships
const { data } = await client.from("posts")
  .select("id, title, author:users(name, email)");

// Insert
const { data, error } = await client.from("items")
  .insert({ name: "New Item", status: "pending" })
  .select()
  .single();

// Update
await client.from("items")
  .update({ status: "completed" })
  .eq("id", 1);

// Delete
await client.from("items")
  .delete()
  .eq("id", 1);

// Upsert
await client.from("items")
  .upsert({ id: 1, name: "Updated Item" });
```

## CLI: Generate Database Types

```bash
# Generate TypeScript types from database schema
npx @neondatabase/neon-js gen-types --db-url "postgresql://user:pass@host:5432/db"

# Custom output path
npx @neondatabase/neon-js gen-types --db-url "..." --output src/types/database.ts

# Multiple schemas
npx @neondatabase/neon-js gen-types --db-url "..." -s public -s auth

# Use generated types
import type { Database } from "./database.types";
const client = createClient<Database>({ ... });
// Now client.from("items") is fully typed!
```

## Environment Variables

```bash
# .env.local (Next.js)
NEON_AUTH_BASE_URL=https://ep-xxx.neonauth.c-2.us-east-2.aws.neon.build/dbname/auth
NEXT_PUBLIC_NEON_AUTH_URL=https://ep-xxx.neonauth.c-2.us-east-2.aws.neon.build/dbname/auth
NEON_DATA_API_URL=https://ep-xxx.apirest.c-2.us-east-2.aws.neon.build/dbname/rest/v1

# .env (Vite/React)
VITE_NEON_AUTH_URL=https://ep-xxx.neonauth.c-2.us-east-2.aws.neon.build/dbname/auth
VITE_NEON_DATA_API_URL=https://ep-xxx.apirest.c-2.us-east-2.aws.neon.build/dbname/rest/v1
```

## Common Mistakes to Avoid

1. **Installing wrong package**: Use `@neondatabase/neon-js` for auth + data API, use `@neondatabase/auth` for auth only. Don't install neon-js if you don't need database queries.
2. **Missing "use client" directive**: Auth client components need `"use client"` at the top
3. **Exposing server URLs in client code**: Use `NEXT_PUBLIC_` prefix only for URLs that should be public
4. **Forgetting CSS import for auth-ui**: Auth UI components need CSS imported from `@neondatabase/neon-js/ui/css`
5. **Using wrong adapter**: Use `BetterAuthReactAdapter` for React hooks, `SupabaseAuthAdapter` for Supabase-compatible API
6. **Not generating types**: Use `npx @neondatabase/neon-js gen-types` for full type safety
7. **Wrong import for BetterAuthReactAdapter**: It's NOT exported from main entry point. Import from `@neondatabase/neon-js/auth/react/adapters`
8. **Not calling adapter as function**: Adapters are factory functions. Use `SupabaseAuthAdapter()` not `SupabaseAuthAdapter`
9. **Wrong createAuthClient signature**: First arg is URL string: `createAuthClient(url, { adapter })` not `createAuthClient({ baseURL })`

## Supabase Migration

```diff
- import { createClient } from "@supabase/supabase-js";
+ import { createClient, SupabaseAuthAdapter } from "@neondatabase/neon-js";

- const client = createClient(SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY);
+ const client = createClient({
+   auth: { adapter: SupabaseAuthAdapter(), url: NEON_AUTH_URL }, // Call adapter as function
+   dataApi: { url: NEON_DATA_API_URL },
+ });

// Auth methods work the same
await client.auth.signInWithPassword({ email, password });
const { data: { session } } = await client.auth.getSession();

// Database queries work the same
const { data } = await client.from("items").select();
```

## Optional

### Theming

For custom themes (colors, radius, dark mode), see [llms-theming.txt](llms-theming.txt).

Quick override example:
```css
:root {
  --primary: oklch(0.55 0.25 250);
  --primary-foreground: oklch(0.98 0 0);
}
```

### Import Paths Reference

**Adapter locations** (all adapters are factory functions - call with `()`):
- `SupabaseAuthAdapter` - `@neondatabase/neon-js` (main) or `@neondatabase/auth/vanilla/adapters`
- `BetterAuthVanillaAdapter` - `@neondatabase/neon-js` (main) or `@neondatabase/auth/vanilla/adapters`
- `BetterAuthReactAdapter` - `@neondatabase/neon-js/auth/react/adapters` or `@neondatabase/auth/react/adapters` (**NOT from main entry**)

From `@neondatabase/neon-js`:
- `@neondatabase/neon-js` - Main client (createClient, SupabaseAuthAdapter, BetterAuthVanillaAdapter)
- `@neondatabase/neon-js/auth/react/adapters` - BetterAuthReactAdapter
- `@neondatabase/neon-js/auth/next` - Next.js integration (authApiHandler, createAuthClient, neonAuth, neonAuthMiddleware)
- `@neondatabase/neon-js/auth/react/ui` - UI components (NeonAuthUIProvider, AuthView, SignInForm, etc.)
- `@neondatabase/neon-js/auth/react/ui/server` - Server utilities (authViewPaths)
- `@neondatabase/neon-js/ui/css` - Pre-built CSS bundle
- `@neondatabase/neon-js/ui/tailwind` - Tailwind-ready CSS

From `@neondatabase/auth` (auth only, same subpaths):
- `@neondatabase/auth` - Auth client (createAuthClient)
- `@neondatabase/auth/vanilla/adapters` - SupabaseAuthAdapter, BetterAuthVanillaAdapter
- `@neondatabase/auth/react/adapters` - BetterAuthReactAdapter
- `@neondatabase/auth/next` - Next.js integration (authApiHandler, createAuthClient, neonAuth, neonAuthMiddleware)
- `@neondatabase/auth/react/ui` - UI components
- `@neondatabase/auth/ui/css` - CSS bundle

### Error Handling Pattern

```typescript
// Auth errors
const { error } = await client.auth.signIn.email({ email, password });
if (error) {
  switch (error.code) {
    case "INVALID_EMAIL_OR_PASSWORD":
      showError("Invalid email or password");
      break;
    case "EMAIL_NOT_VERIFIED":
      showError("Please verify your email");
      break;
    default:
      showError("Authentication failed");
  }
}

// Database errors
const { data, error } = await client.from("items").select();
if (error) {
  console.error("Database error:", error.message);
}
```

- [Neon Documentation](https://neon.tech/docs)
- [Better Auth Documentation](https://www.better-auth.com/docs)
- [Better Auth UI](https://better-auth-ui.com)
